intro: Bidens polylepis, commonly known as the hairy beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture. Bidens polylepis is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in challenging environments.
